title: Unjust Ban for "Intentionally Feeding"
body:
Yesterday on 11/6, I was banned for 14 days after a ranked duo match for "intentionally feeding". During this match, I had no intent on deliberately helping the enemy team and causing my team to lose the game. If you look at the game where I was playing as Wukong, it's evident that my KDA wasn't that great and from an outside perspective it looks as if I wanted to lose. However, I still continued to play and try my best against my laner who was quite fed at that point. I decided to go to other lanes to snag some kills, especially on the Anivia who was vulnerable in lane. I made mistakes here and there and I died multiple times to Anivia and her jungler, J4. My teammates started calling me out for intentionally feeding and I didn't know how to respond to them. My teammates then told the enemy team to report me as well, and the enemy team also believed I intentionally fed them. To add on, the rest of my team didn't do well against their own matchups and practically gave up as well. Looking back at my match history, I have multiple games where I had many deaths and people believed I was intentionally feeding, but this wasn't the case in all of them. I have a very erratic and aggressive playstyle but I do genuinely try to cooperate with my teammates regardless of what they think of me. I have no way of proving that I never intentionally fed, but I assure you the thought of intentional feeding has never crossed my mind. I sent a support ticket to Riot yesterday but no response yet, and the end of the season is approaching so I fear that my deserved rewards will not be given to me. I'm aware that a lift on a ban would normally not be lifted under any circumstances, but I believe that this is one of those cases where the Instant Feedback system wrongly punished a player. I implore a Rioter to take a look at my case and consider an unban, thank you.

Link to match history: http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2638460811/202396175?tab=overview
The 12 minute game makes it apparent that my team gave up, but not as a result of my actions. They all wanted the game to end and quickly gave up, even as I continued to try to fight the enemy.
